149 wounded | casualties2 = 335 killed
336 wounded | casualties3 = | notes = | campaignbox = }} {{Texas Campaign}} {{Campaignbox Mexican-American War}} The '''Texas Campaign''' was the first front in the [[Mexican-American War]], fought between the [[United States]] and [[Mexico]]. The front started with a Mexican assault near [[Brownsville, Texas|Brownsville]]. US forces were forced to surrender after hours of resisting, which lead President [[James K. Polk]] to declare war on Mexico. After the United States defeated a larger Mexican Army at Palo Alto and Resaca de la Palma, Mexican Forces led by [[Mariano Arista]] retreated out of Texas. ==External links== *[http://www.mymexicanwar.com/battles/460425.htm Battle report and list of casualties] *[http://library.uta.edu/usmexicowar/ A Continent Divided: The U.S.-Mexico War], Center for Greater Southwestern Studies, the University of Texas at Arlington [[Category:Texas Campaign]] [[Category:1846 in Texas]]
